適.definition: to fit; suitable; proper; just (now); comfortable; well; to go; to follow or pursue

適值.definition: just at that time; as it happens; by good luck, just then

適可而止.definition: (idiom) to refrain from going too far; to know when to stop

適婚期.definition: age range suitable for getting married

適存度.definition: fitness (evolution); ability to survive and reproduce

適得其反.definition: to produce the opposite of the desired result

適得其所.definition: exactly what one would wish; to find one's niche

適應.definition: to adapt; to fit; to suit

適才.definition: just now; a moment ago (often used in the early vernacular)

適時.definition: timely; apt to the occasion; in due course

適格.definition: to be qualified (to bring a complaint, lawsuit etc) (law)

適老化.definition: to make (products, living spaces etc) suitable for the elderly; (attributive) senior-friendly; elder-accessible

適航.definition: to be airworthy; to be seaworthy

適逢.definition: to just happen to coincide with

適逢其會.definition: (idiom) to happen to be in the right place at the right time

適銷.definition: marketable; saleable; appropriate to the market

適間.definition: just now; just a moment ago

適齡.definition: of age; of the appropriate age
